meanings.sent1: The water in the pot started upboiling rapidly.
meanings.sent2: She upboiled the soup until it was ready to serve.
meanings.sent3: The upboiling water danced in the pot, eager to cook the pasta.
meanings.sent4: His anger upboiled inside him, ready to explode.
meanings.sent5: The volcano upboiled with fiery intensity, spewing lava into the sky.

meanings.sent1: The chef's upboiling of the soup created a delicious aroma in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The upboiling of the water caused bubbles to rise to the surface.
meanings.sent3: The upboiling of the cauldron seemed almost magical to the children watching.
meanings.sent4: The upboiling of emotions in the room made the atmosphere tense.
meanings.sent5: The upboiling of the pot created a symphony of bubbling sounds.

meanings.definition: The state of being boiled vigorously.
meanings.sent1: The intense upboiling of the liquid indicated it was ready.
meanings.sent2: The upboiling of the water signaled the start of cooking.
meanings.sent3: The upboiling of the pot made it difficult to see inside.
meanings.sent4: The upboiling of the situation led to a quick resolution.
meanings.sent5: The upboiling of the stew filled the room with a savory scent.
